intro: Diplocaulobium brevicolle, commonly known as the small-stalked water starwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It typically grows in shallow, freshwater habitats such as ponds and slow-moving streams. The plant has a creeping rhizome with floating leaves that are oval to lance-shaped. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often emerging from the water surface. It plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small invertebrates and contributing to water quality maintenance.
